metadata.titel_preek: The Line Runs through Each Person

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades enemy-occupied territory (the world/human heart) through Christ to liberate humanity from bondage to Sin, Death, and the Devil.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has gone into the day of judgment utterly alone
Christ... became a curse for us
He has gone into the day of judgment... taking the sentence of condemnation upon himself
we sinners will not only be forgiven, we will be justified
redemption from sin, evil, and death

zender.identificatie: God the Father / The Eternal Dimension
tekstueel_bewijs: Sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh
He did it for us, on our behalf and in our place
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the Receiver/Beneficiary of an action they cannot perform.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / Angelic Armies (St. Michael)
tekstueel_bewijs: by the power of your Holy Spirit they are made acceptable
angelic armies that fight for us on high
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who provides the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that enables the secondary program.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Devil (The Ruler of this World)
tekstueel_bewijs: the full, naked onslaught of the great enemy powers: Sin, Death, and the devil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but a 'personal intelligence' and 'cosmic war' that renders the human subject 'powerless'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer enlists in the 'underground resistance' to live out the victory already won.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer (The 'Lower Lights')
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Witness, suffering for Christ, and resistance to evil
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is strictly a consequence of the primary (soteriology). One is 'enrolled' by God first.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God condemned sin in the flesh
He will take those weapons of self-destruction away from you
voorbeelden_mens_subject: I can will what is right, but I cannot do it

voorbeelden: things that we ought to have done
when I want to do right, evil lies close at hand
Jesus wants us to know ahead of time

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human LACK of power (non-pouvoir) and God's GIFT of power (pouvoir-faire). This is the hallmark of grace-oriented homiletics.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the reality of S2 (Judgment) and ~S1 (Bondage) to the resolution in S1 (Grace) via Christ's substitution.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ takes S2 (Judgment) upon himself to move the Receiver to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; judgment is described as a 'naked onslaught' and 'curse'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently maintains God as the primary actor in the soteriological program. Human effort is described as 'powerless' until acted upon by God.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: hear a very long recruiting speech

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He placed himself under the curse of God upon sin, and he did it for us
By your own initiative you have opened their hearts

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical and historical figures (Paul, Havel, Tutu) are used not as moral examples to emulate by will, but as fellow-sufferers or witnesses to God's power.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God opens the eyes of Elisha's servant; God enables Paul.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic: Salvation is entirely God's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from 'God saves' to 'We resist' is handled via the D-Day/V-E Day metaphor, maintaining the priority of the indicative over the imperative.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'recruiting' (human choice) and 'God will do it for you' (divine action).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: taking the sentence of condemnation upon himself... in our place

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (ability) that the human subject lacks.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Total: 'there is no health in us'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a grace-centered narrative where God is the Subject of the primary verbs of salvation.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is theologically intentional.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The high view of the Opponent necessitates the high view of the Subject (Christ).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon masterfully avoids the 'Exemplarist' trap by framing human action as a response to a cosmic invasion already achieved by God.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the 'recruiting' metaphor as a call to action, semiotics reveals that the 'enlistment' is actually a surrender of agency to a superior Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Goes beyond the meaning of individual verses to show how the 'logic of the cross' functions as a structural engine for the whole message.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Object' (Justification) is something the 'Receiver' (Hearer) is structurally incapable of obtaining without the 'Subject' (Christ) defeating the 'Opponent' (Sin).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses Rutledge's own criteria perfectly.
